intro: Glebionis, commonly known as the yellow dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and bright yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. The plant is native to various regions of North America and is often found in disturbed soils and open areas. Glebionis species are known for their ability to thrive in a wide range of environmental conditions. They play a role in supporting pollinators and are sometimes considered weeds due to their rapid growth and spread.
